meanings.definition: To charge excessively or beyond normal levels.
meanings.sent1: She tends to hypercharge her phone every night, which can damage the battery.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic warned not to hypercharge the car battery to avoid any issues.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally hypercharged his laptop, and now it won't turn on!
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to hypercharge the atmosphere, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The kids' excitement seemed to hypercharge the room, filling it with energy.

meanings.definition: An excessive or above normal amount of charge.
meanings.sent1: The hypercharge on the electric bill was a result of leaving the lights on all night.
meanings.sent2: The power bank had a hypercharge capacity, allowing multiple devices to be charged at once.
meanings.sent3: The hypercharge on the phone bill made him realize he had been using too much data.
meanings.sent4: The hypercharge of emotions in the room was palpable, creating a tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The hypercharge of sugar in the candy gave the kids a burst of energy.

meanings.definition: To overcharge or overfill with energy.
meanings.sent1: The coach decided to hypercharge the team with a motivational speech before the game.
meanings.sent2: The energy drink claimed to hypercharge your body for hours of activity.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally hypercharged the blender, causing it to malfunction.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to hypercharge the crowd, getting everyone on their feet.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting seemed to hypercharge the room with life.
